column1: #Text=Polycrystalline  samples  of  BaFe4As12  were  prepared  at  high  temperatures  and  high  pressures.
#Text=BaFe4As12  was  synthesized  using  a  KAWAI-type  double-stage  multi-anvil  high-pressure  apparatus.
#Text=We  used  eight  tungsten  carbide  cubes  with  a  truncated  edge  length  of  11  mm  as  the  second  stage  anvils.
#Text=The  sample  container,  made  of  magnesia  (MgO  +  5%  Cr2O3),  was  transformed  into  an  octahedron  of  18  mm  on  the  stage.
#Text=The  starting  materials  were  put  into  a  crucible  made  of  boron  nitride (BN).
#Text=The crucible, with a graphite heater surrounded with a zirconia (ZrO2) thermal insulator was  inserted  into  the  magnesia  octahedron.
#Text=The  samples  were  prepared  by  reacting  stoichiometric  amounts of 3N (99.9% pure)-Ba chips, 4N-Fe and 6N-As powders at 4 GPa.
#Text=The prepared samples were characterized by powder x-ray diffraction using Co Kα1
